content.transcript:
Cuts, spots and sores are an ideal place for bacterial multiplication. Septic cuts and boils often harbour large numbers of food poisoning organisms.

Food handlers with open wounds or skin infections should not handle food or be allowed to work in food rooms.

To prevent contamination of food by harmful bacteria and blood, these lesions should be completely covered by waterproof dressings, preferably coloured blue to aid detection if they become detached.

Dressings should be replaced immediately if they become loose. Cuts on fingers may need the extra protection of waterproof finger-stalls.

Blue, waterproof dressings are an essential part of the first aid box. Antiseptics and pills should not be included.

page.statement: First aid box must contain blue waterproof dressings.
